title: Drawing, Design for Wallpaper or Textile of Daisy-Type Flower with Repeat, ca. 1860
title_raw: Design for Wallpaper or Textile of Daisy-Type Flower with Repeat
medium: Black and white chalk on heavy  blue wove paper, squared in graphite
creditline: Museum purchase through bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Carefully drawn study, in black and white, of daisy-type flower (perhaps rudbekia or coreopsis).  One plant spray placed in upper middle of sheet, with frontal view of flower upper center and profile views of flowers to left and right.  Second flower spray is beneath with flowers placed left and right.  Lightly sketched partial views of flower indicating repeat on upper and lower edges.  Full repeat marked on four sides in ruled graphite lines, with ruled graphite lines also marking centers vertically and horizontally.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Wallpaper or Textile of Daisy-Type Flower with Repeat, ca. 1860. Black and white chalk on heavy  blue wove paper, squared in graphite. 
Museum purchase through bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 2000-28-1
